results.title: High country
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Geoff Burrowes and Yenan Productions
results.brief_description: A group of amateur horsemen cross Victoria’s Great Dividing Range using a little frequented track. Shows without commentary, the grandeur and mystique of the region. Music by Mario Mills and Jon English

results.title: Whistle for Willie
results.creator_credit: Mal Wittman, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The story of a little boy trying to learn how to whistle for his dog the way the older boys do is told in lovely simple words and beautiful glowing pictures. The minimal animation adds beauty to Ezra Jack Keats’ cut-paper illustrations. Story teller: Jane Harvey. From the book written and illustrated by Ezra Jack Keates.

results.title: The Animal movie
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Ron Tunis, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon to help children explore why and how animals move as they do. A little boy discovers that he cannot compete with animals - monkey, snake, horse etc - by imitating the way they move. He only outdistances them when he climbs into a vehicle that can travel in any environment - proving that, while other animals are trapped by their environment, man, the inventor, isn’t. An award winning film.

results.title: The Cavity caper
results.creator_credit: Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatisation for children on the subject of dental care, in which Big Al and Louis try to outwit Kev Casual, but the Tooth Fairy comes to the rescue. The Army is also brought into the fight against plaque No other credits available. Cast includes Colin Friels. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Athletes (Greek)
results.brief_description: The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some very excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain.

results.title: Wirritt wirritt [Italian version]: an Australian legend
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian National Film Board and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Artist James Cant re-creates, in rock paintings, an ancient Aboriginal legend about the origins of making fire. Narrated by Ray Barrett.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef (Italian)
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Great Barrier Reef of Queensland is one of the great reservoirs of marine and animal life. This documentary shows in detail, the birds, fish and mammals of the area and the work being done by scientists in studying them. A long sequence deals with the life cycle of the turtle, another with the microscopic creatures of the sea.

results.title: The Big island [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: Somewhere to go
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Hugh Hudson, South Australian Minister for Education, discusses the establishment of school-based community centres in two Adelaide suburbs, Thebarton and Angle Park. The surveys and plans, initiated in mid 1973, show that an essential feature of the planning process was the participation of the communities concerned.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Bergin, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Safety in your hands
results.creator_credit: John Fitzgerald, Edwin Scragg, Jill Robb and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This 1974 film examines the responsibility of each worker for their own safety in the workplace. The film focuses particularly on protection of hands and eyes in industrial settings, showing a variety of machines operated by people. It demonstrates how untidiness, inattention, overconfidence and failure to use safety precautions such as safety glasses when operating these machines can lead to accidents. Footage of industrial workplaces is interspersed with footage of everyday accidents similarly caused by mess, distraction and overconfidence.

Produced by the South Australian Film Corporation for the South Australian Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.
